text: William Percival Sadlier (1896–1968) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s. A product from the Brighton JRLFC, Bill 'Chid' Sadlier was a pioneer rugby league player with the St. George club during its earliest years.Whiticker/Hudson, "The ENcyclopedia of Rugby League Players" 1995 Edition () Sadlier was awarded Life Membership of the St. George Dragons in 1951 after 34 years service as a player, coach, selector and committeeman.LIFE MEMBERS List http://www.jubileeavenue.com.au/history/records.php Sadlier died on 20 August 1968 at Sylvania, New South Wales.Sydney Morning Herald- Death Notice 22/8/1968 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:1896 births Category:1968 deaths Category:Australian rugby league coaches Category:Australian rugby league administrators Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league wingers Category:Rugby league locks Category:Rugby league players from Sydney
title: Bill Sadlier
